intro: Campylocentrum carvalhoi, commonly known as the Brazilian star orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically features linear to lanceolate leaves and produces showy inflorescences with numerous small, fragrant blooms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil for optimal growth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest in botanical conservation efforts.
